item.title: Report X-2024121336
item.description:
Report X-2024121336

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-21
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 21st a package was discovered during the AM sort that had a very strong odor. The package was marked as UN1263, Paint, 3, III. Further investigation showed that one of the cans was not seals completely allowing some of the paint to escape and leading to the odor. The package wa splaced into a salvage drum and the shipper contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

item.title: Report X-2024121326
item.description:
Report X-2024121326

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 19th a package was found during the sort that was dropped while handling. This caused one of the receptacles inside the packge to leak and a chemical smell was noticed. Opening the package the inner contents were discovered to be denatured alcohol, per the SDS UN1987 Alcohols, n.o.s.(Ethyl Alcohol, Methanol), 3, PGII. There were no markings on the outer package indicating the package contained dangerous goods. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is being held pending investigation/disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024120433
item.description:
Report E-2024120433

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: Connersville
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The material shipped as 1/ 85-gallon drum (received on 12/18/2024) of solids containing flammable liquids for disposal. The material was from a spill cleanup of a 55-gal drum of waste paint related material that leaked in in-transit storage. The material was managed as a hazardous waste. Reclaimed Energy managed the waste in an appropriate manner. The generator has been notified.

item.title: Report E-2024120466
item.description:
Report E-2024120466

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1751 ET, Drew Rechenmacher with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BIN. It was reported that an unknown amount of UN1050 Hydrogen Cloride released from cylinder due to lose valve. The release impacted trailer # 3191604. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. The Contractor tested the air in the trailer with an air meter, colorimetric (Draeger) detection tubes, and a series of pH strips in various sections of the trailer. No waste was generated.
